intro: Cyrtandra behrmanniana, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
